newsitem.title: PERU: Peru signs oil exploration contract with Phillips.
newsitem.headline: Peru signs oil exploration contract with Phillips.

text.p: The government has signed a contract with the United States' Phillips Petroleum Ltd to explore and develop Block 82 in central Peru, officials said Monday.
They did not give details of reserves at the oil block, which lies in the departments of Ucayali and Madre de Dios, or of the estimated investment.
However, the government said last month it estimated the contracts it was due to sign in December would each require an investment of around $40 million.

The government has now signed 11 oil contracts this year. Energy and Mines Minister Alberto Pandolfi has said Peru hopes to sign a further three contracts before the end of the year, and eight more in 1997.
Of the government's 36 current oil contracts with private companies, 21 are at the exploration stage and 15 are producing oil.

The government has said the state oil company Petroperu's licensing arm, Perupetro, is also close to signing contracts involving Peruvian miner Buenaventura, oil giants Royal Dutch/Shell Mobil Corp, Atlantic Richfield Co, and Argentina's Pluspetrol Corp.
